pros: Fantastic program designed for full-time working professionals. In-Person classes are once a month, from Thursday-Sunday. cons: Very fast-paced, expect +30 hours of work every week: including group projects, office hours, quizzes, etc…

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Babson Park, MA
pros:
-Beautiful campus
-great students from every walk of life
-decent benefits
-small organization
-tons of potential
-access to great resources if you want to start a business/ get your MBA
-travel opportunities
cons:
-Small organization

-Terrible Management

-HR does not embrace in reality any of what students are taught in the classroom about business, entrepreneurship and management. "Try it- if it doesn't work, try again is NOT Entrepreneurship.

-Mediocre talent led by mediocre leadership. People in lower and middle management are hired based on their proximity to campus it seems instead of their value to the institution. 

-No one seems to actually care about accomplishing anything and instead ride the pitiful excitement of #1 rankings

-Lots of bitterness from staff who are socially/economically different than wealthy students. 

-constant identity crisis of Staff who believe education is not a business and therefore aren't productive, but still receive paychecks...

job_title: Service Technician in Babson Park, MA
pros: It's a very relaxed and flexible environment. They understand student workers have incredibly busy lives and need a simple part time job to provide for that busy lifestyle. The management was generally very accommodating to fluctuating work schedules and midterms/projects etc. Plus there was no shortage of staff
cons: There wasn't really an apparent method of advancing. Granted again this was a student position, but even then, there were a few options that allowed a worker to "advance" within the sector. There just never seemed to be a clear idea of what skills, attributes, or work values the management sought to promote these people. Training was also incredibly over simplified, with a lot of on the job training, which wasn't a problem if there had been an encouraging attitude of people willing to help, instead I felt there was a general feeling of distaste with anyone who knew less than you

review_title: Babson has it's up's and downs
pros: The benefits are really genrous they give you a lot of time off right from the start.  There are numerous events on campus year round and they encorouge the staff to participate.  Working in an academic environment open a lot of opportunities for exposure to people of different cultures and beliefs.  My time there was an eye opening experience in which I learned a lot
cons: Scheduling, promotional opportunities and communication to support staff is limited.  Feedback can be very limited and I found that there was little recognition or opportunity outside of my department for feedback or recognition.  Hour can be long and demanding while some of the staff is given flex schedules during the summer months support staff is generally excluded from this benefit

review_title: Great people and great benefits make Babson College a great place to work!
pros: The people and the benefits are the two best reasons to work at Babson.  Everyone (faculty, staff, and students) is great to work with.  I've been employed at Babson College for over 10 years, in multiple departments / divisions and positions.  At each stop, I have felt as if I was part of a family.  The atmosphere is truly welcoming and supportive and there is ample opportunity for self-starters to create value and move forward with projects / initiatives that benefit the College.
cons: One of the downsides of working at any College is the salary.  In general, College's are unable to match the upper half of the salaries in a given field - and possibly less in technology fields.

review_title: Amazing work-life balance, but senior leadership underwhelms
pros: Many paid holidays, flex hours during Summer, beautiful place to work. Each branch of the school definitely feels like a small community. Perks such as the free gym/pool use are great.
cons: A ton of silos within the college, pay is lower than other schools in area, hard to get to if you live in Boston/Cambridge. Senior leadership is reluctant to change and very bureaucratic, which stands in stark contrast with the "entrepreneurial" spirit that the school is supposed to have.

review_title: Great job, but only for a college student who has nothing better to do.
job_title: Event Staff in Babson Park, MA
pros: Good people and good location.  The atmosphere is good, and there are a lot of great networking oppurtunites with the number of people associated with the college.  Wellesley is great college town that has alot to offer anyone who spends alot of time there.
cons: They do not pay very well. Also, it is difficult to move up because they often hire  from outside for upper level positions that pay the best money. Also, there is limited parking throughout the campus, which often makes it difficult to come and go.

pros: I loved working for a school I admire with a great community.  Many of the team in fundraising and alumni relations are outstanding.
cons:
Management was terrible.  Brian Barefoot was the worst President I can imagine.  He scoffed at employees, never wanting to spend more than a minute in the hallway talking to college workers.

Other senior leadership were equally awful, offering very little in the way of work life balance.

pros: Great educators who want to mentor you and encourage you to reach your full potential. Willing to listen to your ideas, however crazy they may be; and always encourage you to be entrepreneurially oriented in all that you do.
cons: My role was particularly concerned with just that department. As such I didn't have much interaction with other departments so it would be hard to say how it would be to coordinate with other departments on a certain initiative. I did, however, interact with many different departments there on different occasions. They were all mostly helpful.

pros: Very knowledgeable people who are experts in their field. The entire faculty and staff live and teach the concept of entrepreneurial thought and action. I learned a lot.
cons: The only downside came with the payroll system. There were times when my manager was out of the country with limited internet access and was unable to approve the hours I submitted and so I did not get paid on time when that happened. Other times my manager approved my hours, but then my pay was not direct deposited into my account.

job_title: Associate Director in Babson Park, MA
pros:
- Benefits such as vacation, retirement fund and planning, healthcare
- HR department spends a lot of effort to engage the employees
cons:
- Very little diversity. Some departments may have more, in the department I worked at out of 70+ people there were only 5 people of color.
- Depending on the department, you are met with very hostile people. Same people have work there for a long time and are just accepted that they are rude. 
- As a whole, the environment feels very "clicky."
- No real way to report ethical issues, if reported to HR, they don't do anything about it.

pros: Direct Manager was amazing and the faculty was a joy to work with.  The faculty is knowledgeable and learned all the business experience on the job, rather than from a text book.  That's what really makes Babson unique as a college.
cons: The administration is absolute crap and there's so much red tape and general bureaucracy that it's really not worth it.  The constant turnover in leadership is disheartening and does not create a good example or cohesive student body.

review_title: Great people and benefits, but limited opportunities for promotion
pros: The benefits of tremendous; 403B contribution match x4! 3 weeks vacation at hire; 5 weeks after 5th anniversary.
cons: Very fluid environment which leads to a lot of tail chasing. Babson has never met an opportunity it didn't like which results in a lot of rush work for administration. Decisions are often made in a vacuum and not effectively communicated downstream. Current management model creates a culture of fear.

pros:
A small beautiful campus, so you will work closely with everyone.  People are easy to get a hold of and almost always willing to help you.  If you take the initiative, you can learn a lot of valuable skills and really build up your experiences.  Great benefits, including a x4 match on your 403b.  Tons of vacation and holidays.  Easy commute for anyone living in metro west.  

I worked with some of the nicest people in the world, and still to this day stay in touch with a lot of them.  You really feel like a "team".  Still to this day, it was the best group of people I've worked with.
cons:
Depending on what group you work in, the pay is not so great.  They really lowball you and there is not much room for negotiation.  You get a 2% increase annually, if you are lucky.  My last role at Babson included supervisory duties.  I took a job elsewhere, non-managerial, and am making over 15% more.  The low pay is not so bad if you are young and ambitious, but ultimately most people will leave for higher paying jobs.  

At times the office was very cut throat and run like an emergency room at a hospital.  Certainly, there will be times when everyone has to do more; however, upper management did not provide great leadership during these times.  During my last year, the “bottom line” became the most important thing, and there was really not much regard to the people making it happen.

pros: Very fun environment with exposure to very smart people and the leaders of tomorrow. Many people I still keep in contact with.
cons: Not many cons except for a terrible set of people in middle management who are politically driven and make the experience a bit nightmarish at times.

review_title: Great work life balance, but don't expect any career growth
pros: Expected to work 40 hours per week at absolute maximum. Staff at lower levels are mostly great people. Benefits are crazy good, tuition remission especially. They offer many, many days off.
cons:
The administration is aimless; always chasing bigger-name schools in the area instead of innovating. A large portion of senior leadership is much more concerned with holding their positions than taking any risk (ironically for an entrepreneurship school). Decisions made at the top become new directives for middle management, but middle management doesn't reorganize to effectively tackle new challenges, leading lower level staff to often scramble and have to take on new responsibilities outside of their expertise. When this happens, there is no recognition past a "thank you" from superiors. 

At this period, the majority of the college's staff is uneasy about the school's future due to the school's frequent accreditation troubles (not enough faculty are researchers, most are former entrepreneurs and businesspeople). 

Extremely low pay, even relative to other non-profits in the Boston area. HR is a nightmare and should absolutely be looked at by the administration as they were ineffective at employee relations at every opportunity for my entire tenure.

pros: Amazing faculty, super smart driven students, amazing job prospects. If a student takes advantage of their time they will get an amazing job.
cons: Dealing with administration is terrible. Nobody working in admin has any idea of what the students want or need. Residence life is completely out to lunch on how to build student life on campus.

review_title: Great Work/Life Balance and Work Environment
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Babson Park, MA
pros: Excellent effort to promote a healthy work/life balance, College offers numerous health and wellness programs as well as free events and employee benefits. Good work environment.
cons: Pay could be a bit more competitive. Employees with tenure at the College are favored and form an exclusive group.

pros: Great food. Great schedule.  This was a great place to work for years, but with new management has sunk fast into the depths of all the pitfalls of not managing competition, and that people deserve respect and kindness, not just pay.
cons: Since new management has taken over, it's more like lord of the flies, or a middle ages survival of the biggest jerk throwback piece.

review_title: Babson College department are full of wonderful people

cons: Some of the tasks I was asked to complete were tedious and unnecessary. And a some of the tasks were unrelated to their functions at Babson.

review_title: Love coming to work every day
pros: A close-knit community full of people who are energetic entrepreneurial thinkers. Great perks for FT such as 403b matching and vacation allowance. Great place for work-life balance. The students are inspiring as they come from diverse backgrounds and are constantly

pros: Good Benefits i.e. paid time off 401 etc. tuition remission, healthy you in addition to twelve paid holidays and a bonus week off in December.

pros: Great benefits, excellent pay, very understanding employees. Flexible management. Care for employees with sick time, on site eye exams once a year, flexible snow days.
